metadata.synopsis: Emperor resumes psychic connection to player once Raphael is done with them and has offered them his deal.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Find Raphael at the SC upstairs and enter his room and finish the initial conversation

115.text: Something was blocking me from hearing your thoughts.

80.text: It's concerning that something could come between us like that, especially when we are so close to the elder brain.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I'm just glad to have you back.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: It was nice to have a moment of peace and quiet.

106.text: I can understand that - there's reprieve in solitude.

23.text: But it's concerning that something could intervene like that, especially when we are so close to the elder brain.

61.text: Do you have any idea what it was?

57.text: Raphael? Well - thank you for your honesty.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: It was the elder brain - it was trying to take hold of me.

96.text: Then the situation is worse than I thought.

77.text: If it read your thoughts, it knows exactly what your intentions are. And it is already plotting counter-moves to stop you.

15.text: We must press on. I will bolster your mental defences. Let us hope that allows us to regain some of our lost advantage before it finds you.

43.text: You're trying to deceive me. But why?

82.text: Someone must have intervened. Someone you don't want me to know about.
82.context: NodeContext: like a detective pacing around a room reasoning to themself aloud

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *You feel the touch of the Emperor's mind peeling at the edge of yours, trying to gain access, and succeeding.*

105.context: NodeContext: stumbling on the correct answer

53.text: Of course. I should have known the devil would come sniffing.

26.text: The stench of impending chaos is irresistible to them.

124.text: And what did he want with you?

79.text: What were the terms of this deal?

135.speaker: Player
135.text: He offered me the means to free Orpheus in exchange for the Crown on top of the brain.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: He knows how to free Orpheus.

38.text: How interesting. No doubt he impressed upon you the need to do so.

126.text: And what did he want in return for this knowledge?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: The Crown that the brain is wearing.

65.text: Tell me you turned him down?

87.text: Tell me you turned him down.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: It was a good deal, all right?

93.text: I was absent for one moment...
93.context: NodeContext: vocal equivalent of a facepalm

130.text: If there is one thing you can be certain of, it is that the devil will come to collect.

140.text: But that is your problem. I will not let you put our survival at risk. I have Orpheus well under control. Stay away from him.

129.text: Now come - we have an elder brain to destroy.
129.context: NodeContext: like an adult making the boundaries clear to a child, and then rediverting their attention back to the main issue

49.speaker: Player
49.text: It was a good deal. I accepted.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I don't see how that's any of your business.

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *You feel the touch of the Emperor's mind peeling at the edge of yours, trying to gain access.*

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Open your mind to it. You have nothing to hide.

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Its thoughts slide into yours, turning through them like fingers, sifting for answers... which it finds.*

89.text: Good. I'm glad. But be careful.

20.text: Then we must be very careful.

21.text: The devil is like a cockroach - no matter what you do to it, it will always come back.

109.text: I doubt this will be the last time you are approached.

59.text: I trust that you will continue to remember who is really on your side.

137.text: Without my protection, you cannot defeat the elder brain. You cannot even get close to it. No matter what the devil whispers in your ear.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: You're the one who's always talking about trust. If you trust me, you'll stop this right now.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Here's an idea - you stay out of my head and I'll stay out of yours.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *You feel its presence withdrawing from the fringes of your awareness.*

55.text: I shall respect your privacy on this occasion.

122.text: But know that if you have jeopardised our mutual project, I will be forced to reconsider our alliance.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Get out of my head or I'll throw the Astral Prism into the Hells.

72.text: And risk becoming enthralled to the elder brain?

63.context: CinematicNodeContext: A beat. Player narrows their eyes angrily - they WOULD dare.

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *Again - the Emperor pries at the boundaries of your thoughts, invasive, curious.*

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Does it matter? I said no.

71.text: I'm glad you had the sense to turn him down. But it certainly does matter.

5.text: Anything that threatens our alliance, threatens our chances of defeating the elder brain.

36.text: So I ask again - what were the terms of the deal he offered you?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: He wanted the Crown the brain is wearing, and offered me the means to free Orpheus.

32.text: Just imagine - a crown of sufficient power to dominate an elder brain atop a devil's head. You would be trading one apocalyptic event for another.

76.text: Thank you for telling me. And for rejecting him.

101.text: And now we must be doubly on our guard.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I don't know, I didn't wait to find out.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: That's between me and the devil.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Does it matter? I turned down his offer.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: He wants the Crown that's on the brain.

47.text: Giving a devil what he wants sounds like a brilliant idea.

104.text: And what did he offer you in return for bringing it to him?

45.text: Then perhaps my protection - but I was sure... never mind.

56.text: We must press on. I will bolster your mental defences and make sure this doesn't happen again.

113.text: You play the fool, and you play it poorly. You know something.
